Wolfblade::

She grinned. "A virus isn't a bad idea."  She drank from her 
cup. "However, we have to come up with a virus that his programs 
can't counteract. Which is near impossible. Second, get someone to 
carry the virus to him, then download it to his mainframe processors. 
Good luck."  She sipped from her cup, and went to get a refill. "Hmm, 
here's a thought. Perhaps since there aren't any black holes in this 
sector, we could make one. All we have to do is to make a small 
sphere of metal and launch it out into space. Then, we give it a 
large electromagnit and throw it into full power. With a large 
explosion from some powerful raw energon, it will give it enough 
force to collapse in on itself and poof, a blackhole will emerge. The 
catch is to create it so far out that this planet won't be effected."


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "bustercross365" <bustercross365@y...> 
wrote:
> Malice chuckled.  
> <So she and I have more in common than I originally thought.>
> "So, you are a manufactured Transmetal 2.  We have the ability to 
> heal, to an extent at least.  So, if we can draw him to a quantum 
> singularity with the appropriate bait, we can bag us a 
Chaosbringer.  
> But there are no blackholes in this sector.  The best bet would 
send 
> him through another sub space instability.  Or..."
> He thought a moment as he took another drink from his mug.
> "... give him a virus.  Cause his space fold system to crash and he 
> can't move in space.  Or sabotage his energy refinery.  Our options 
> are not very favorable, even for me."
> He thought more on the subject, taking another drink from his mug. 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "shadowess_azogoth" 
> <shadowess_azogoth@y...> wrote:
> > Wolfblade::
> > 
> >   She grinned. "My turn huh. WEll, first off, wolves are not 
bounty 
> > hunters in the same way your thinking. But hunters we are. As for 
a 
> > secret I possess, I will tell you one thing. It doesn't take two 
to 
> > keep a secret."  She grinned and sipped her drink. "However, I do 
> > believe in returning a favor for a favor. First off, Yes, I am 
from 
> > another dimension. How I got here or why I'm here is beyond my 
> mental 
> > processors. However, I do know what will tempt Unicron. IT's 
three 
> > things he can't resist. Energy, knowledge and metal.  HE uses 
metal 
> > to rejuvinate himself, energy for the same reasons we need it, 
and 
> > knowledge. He wants to be a god. Better than the matrix. He 
thinks 
> > he's the smartest thing out there and that he knows everything 
> there 
> > is to know except the future. But since he's almost invincable, 
he 
> > doesn't care about attacks from smaller enemies. He's too big to 
> > stop. However, he can still be outsmarted. Ever hear of something 
> > called a BlackHole?  I did it once before in my universe. We had 
> > rigged something to make Unicron think we had found the EYE OF 
THE 
> > MATRIX.  It lets one see into the past, present and future. He 
> wanted 
> > it so bad, he followed me into a black hole. I made it by chance 
> out 
> > the other end. He was way to big to fit through the small Quazar 
> and 
> > was stuck forever. So, now you have info on me." She 
grinned, "Oh, 
> > and one more little thing, if you want a secret about me. I am 
made 
> > of a substance called Zianium. It's stronger and more duable than 
> > Transmetal. But unlike metal, it can, ah, heal itself. LIke a 
true 
> > organic can heal from a wound or sickness. And, I have a 
substance 
> > similar to the organic liquid called blood. It's thicker and has 
a 
> > blue color, but it's not just mech fluid. I was one of seven like 
> > myself. We were the prototypes. But, well, "  she looked at her 
> > drink. "Never mind anyway, favor returned. Find something to look 
> > like an EYE OF THE MATRIX and lure Unicron into a black hole. 
He'll 
> > fall in and your rid of him."
> > 
> >
